Current on the right-hand vertical side flows upward (from b to a)
In a resistive wire the potential drops along the direction of current, so point b is at the higher potential
V_a – V_b = –0.050 V, i.e. the magnitude of the potential difference is 0.05 V with point b at the higher potential
